messages.subject: Re: Swapping
messages.msgSnippet: Bloomfield is very close to Bloomington.  About 35-40 min. Unschooling definitely is a family affair around here.  With Mom just up the driveway, and her being
messages.messageBody:
Bloomfield is very close to Bloomington. About 35-40 min.
Unschooling definitely is a family affair around here. With Mom just up the
driveway, and her being the only grandparent left, my kids live in a wonderland.
Ann

> From: FreeSchool@...
>
> In a message dated 6/2/99 10:39:10 PM Central Daylight Time,
> hooperck@... writes:
>
> << Where is Evanston? My grandmother is in Bloomfield. We are going to be
> with her
> for a week in August. She is 93, and my Aunt and Uncle are going on a
> trip, so
> I'm going with my kids to be with her.
> Is that close? >>
>
> Ann,
> Evansville is in the Southwest corner of Indiana. Are you going to
> Bloomington?
> It is about 2 hours from Evansville. If it is Bloomfield, I will have to
> look it up, because I haven't heard of it. That doesn't mean that is doesn't
> exist, of course, there are alot of cities in Indiana that I haven't heard of
> until recently. Meeting homeschoolers on the internet is really widening my
> horizons! Hey, does that mean mom is unschooling too?
> I guess that is what we have all been trying to get across huh, that
> unschooling is a family lifestyle?
> Tami in IN

messages.subject: Re: Swapping
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/2/99 10:39:10 PM Central Daylight Time, hooperck@teleplex.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/2/99 10:39:10 PM Central Daylight Time,
hooperck@... writes:

<< Where is Evanston? My grandmother is in Bloomfield. We are going to be
with her
for a week in August. She is 93, and my Aunt and Uncle are going on a
trip, so
I'm going with my kids to be with her.
Is that close? >>

Ann,
Evansville is in the Southwest corner of Indiana. Are you going to
Bloomington?
It is about 2 hours from Evansville. If it is Bloomfield, I will have to
look it up, because I haven't heard of it. That doesn't mean that is doesn't
exist, of course, there are alot of cities in Indiana that I haven't heard of
until recently. Meeting homeschoolers on the internet is really widening my
horizons! Hey, does that mean mom is unschooling too?
I guess that is what we have all been trying to get across huh, that
unschooling is a family lifestyle?
Tami in IN

messages.subject: Re: Swapping
messages.msgSnippet: Tami, Where is Evanston?  My grandmother is in Bloomfield.  We are going to be with her for a week in August.  She is 93, and  my Aunt and Uncle are going on a
messages.messageBody:
Tami,
Where is Evanston? My grandmother is in Bloomfield. We are going to be with her
for a week in August. She is 93, and my Aunt and Uncle are going on a trip, so
I'm going with my kids to be with her.
Is that close?
Ann

messages.subject: Re: Swapping
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/2/99 5:26:43 AM Central Daylight Time, mjcmbrwn@ihug.co.nz writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/2/99 5:26:43 AM Central Daylight Time,
mjcmbrwn@... writes:

<< I think travel is a wonderful aspect made possible by
> the freedom from madated school schedules that homeschooling, and
> Unschooling in particular, provide. We have a 2,000 sq. ft. home w >>

Hey, this sounds great! My problem is that although we have over 2,000 sq.
ft., with four kids there are no extra bedrooms! The other problem is that
the closest *big* (ha ha) city that I live by is Evansville, IN. I don't
really think there will be many people fighting to come my way! However, if
anyone does, I am sure my kids wont mind doubling up and letting someone have
their room!
Tami

messages.subject: Re: Swapping
messages.msgSnippet: ... Carol, Not sure I can help you there.  We would love to travel, but with two babies, a new house that is getting a big interior facelift, and a pending
messages.messageBody:
>Yeah, great! Problem - not sure I can afford the travel costs - I live in New
>Zealand <vbg>
>
>Carol

Carol,
Not sure I can help you there. We would love to travel, but with two
babies, a new house that is getting a big interior facelift, and a pending
adoption, our travel funds are rather nonexistent. This is just not a good
time for us to leave home.

I don't suppose you could stow away somewhere?....ah well, another time.
Perhaps the opportunity will arise, or be created by you!

Nanci K.

messages.subject: Swapping
messages.msgSnippet: ... Yeah, great! Problem - not sure I can afford the travel costs - I live in New Zealand  Carol
messages.messageBody:
Thomas and Nanci Kuykendall wrote:

> <cut>
> How about the idea of swapping or timesharing or just plain sharing lodging
> for travel purposes? I think travel is a wonderful aspect made possible by
> the freedom from madated school schedules that homeschooling, and
> Unschooling in particular, provide. We have a 2,000 sq. ft. home with a
> couple of extra bedrooms and/or couch space and we happen to live within an
> hour of Glacier and Yellowstone National Parks!

Yeah, great! Problem - not sure I can afford the travel costs - I live in New
Zealand <vbg>

Carol
